snippet: Two Legislative Council members altered the wording of their oaths of office, potentially setting off a rare legal battle....
abstract: Large amount of invective directed at newly elected Hong Kong lawmakers Yau Wai-ching and Sixtus Leng in China's state-controlled media has raised fears China may circumvent Hong Kong's legal process to bar lawmakers from office; Yau and Leung altered oath of office to make clear their separatist stance, which has prompted review of whether they can retake oath of office.

byline.original: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and ALAN WONG
byline.contributor: Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Two Legislative Council members altered the wording of their oaths of office, potentially setting off a rare legal battle.

headline.main: Separatist Hong Kong Lawmakers Draw Fears of Intervention by China
headline.print_headline: Blunt Reply From China to Separatist Hong Kong Lawmakers
